Title:
Phylogenetic assessment of the monotypic genera Sundacarpus
Page and Manoao Molloy (Coniferales: Podocarpaceae) utilising evidence
from 18S rDNA sequences. Australian
Abstract:
The Podocarpaceae are the most morphologically diverse of
conifer families. A taxonomic trend has resulted in recognizing this
diversity via smaller generic groupings, including several monotypes. A
phylogenetic assessment of the monotypic genera Sundacarpus and Manoao
was conducted employing maximum parsimony analysis of sequence data from
18S ribosomal DNA from 34 gymnosperm taxa, including 29 Podocarpaceae.
In resulting trees, there is high bootstrap support for Podocarpaceae,
including Phyllocladus, but the order of deep branches within the family
is equivocal. Prumnopitys (Sundacarpus) amara and four other Prumnopitys
spp. comprise a clade with a bootstrap value of 100%, supporting the
retention of Sundacarpus as a section of Prumnopitys. Lagarostrobos
franklinii and L. (Manoao) colensoi comprise a clade with equivocal
bootstrap support, echoing previous results from parsimony analysis of
morphological data. A conservative approach (i.e., one avoiding
unnecessary monotypes), favors the retention of L. colensoi in
Lagarostrobos, pending further evidence of relationships within the
group.
